qas.question: How much in stimulus money was announced in 2008?
Who was the Mayor of Detroit in 2011?
What is the plan called that seeks to clear land for neighborhood construction?
How many acres of land does the Far Eastside Plan seek to clear?
How was the 2008 stimulus plan payed for?

answers.text: earmarking about 15% of the wagering tax

context: Public funding and private investment have also been made with promises to rehabilitate neighborhoods. In April 2008, the city announced a <a0_0>$300-million<a0_0/> stimulus plan to create jobs and revitalize neighborhoods, financed by city bonds and paid for by <a4_0>earmarking about 15% of the wagering tax<a4_0/>. The city's working plans for neighborhood revitalizations include 7-Mile/Livernois, Brightmoor, East English Village, Grand River/Greenfield, North End, and Osborn. Private organizations have pledged substantial funding to the efforts. Additionally, the city has cleared a <a3_0>1,200<a3_0/>-acre (490 ha) section of land for large-scale neighborhood construction, which the city is calling the <a2_0>Far Eastside Plan<a2_0/>. In 2011, <a1_0>Mayor Bing<a1_0/> announced a plan to categorize neighborhoods by their needs and prioritize the most needed services for those neighborhoods.
